glosses: To lose control on oneself because of being astonished, bewildered, boggled
To stagger, to lose one's balance and to move awkwardly

etymology: From afal afal, aval aval + -la (verbalizing suffix), from Arabic أحول (ʔaḥwal, “cross-eyed”). Originally a dialectical term brought into the written standard during the language reform. See also Ottoman Turkish آفال طاپال (afal tapal, “dumbfounded, dumbstruck”).
